greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sequence is S(infinity) where S(1)={1,2} and S(n)=S(n-1)S'(n-1), where S'(k) is obtained from S(k) by replacing the single 1 with the least integer not occurring in S(k).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
example: S(1)={1,2} then S'(1)={3,2} and sequence begins 1,2,3,2
xref: Essentially the same as A085058 (with prepended 1 and different indexing).
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 04 2003
